column4: Is there any way I can see a list of most recently installed packages?
yes you can view the log in /var/log/dpkg or /var/log/synaptic iirc
sorry im not 100% sure off the top of my head, but maybe its /var/log/aptitude
2 ticks, let me check in my virtual machine :)
i have the 2nd one, thank you
if you install files through apt-get or synaptic, then it will write to dpkg.log (they all use dpkg to install files)
aptitude is another tool and i think it writes to dpkg.log as well, as well as /var/log/aptitude so if you haven't used aptitude, that would explain it
depends how you installed from source code, did you create a .deb file and thus install with dpkg?
then unfortunately the log files mentioned will have no record of installing those packages, as you must have manually make/make install'd them
you could check "history" to see your terminal commands and check from that
